name: Honda CB Hornet 160R CBS
short_description: Honda CB Hornet 160R CBS - A muscular streetfighter with aggressive styling, refined 160cc engine, and CBS braking system for confident city riding.

faqs.question: Difference between CBS and ABS?
faqs.answer: CBS links both brakes when one is applied, while ABS prevents wheel lock-up.

name: Honda CB Shine SP
short_description: Honda CB Shine SP - A premium 125cc commuter bike with refined engine, comfortable ergonomics and sporty styling elements.

Honda CB Shine SP Side View
Honda CB Shine SP Rear View
Honda CB Shine SP Back View

faqs.question: Difference from standard Shine?
faqs.answer: SP has sportier graphics, better suspension and premium finish.

name: Honda CBR 150R ABS
short_description: Honda CBR 150R ABS - A fully-faired sportbike with liquid-cooled engine, 6-speed gearbox and ABS for confident braking.

name: Honda CBR 150R ABS Motogp Edition
short_description: Honda CBR 150R ABS Motogp Edition - A special edition of the CBR150R with MotoGP-inspired livery and premium components.

faqs.question: Difference from standard?
faqs.answer: Only cosmetic - MotoGP livery and graphics.

faqs.question: ABS type?
faqs.answer: Same dual-channel ABS as standard model.

name: Honda Dio
short_description: Honda Dio - A stylish and sporty 110cc scooter known for its peppy performance, good mileage and youthful appeal.

name: Honda Dream 110 Red
short_description: Honda Dream 110 Red - A basic 110cc commuter bike known for its reliability, excellent mileage and low maintenance costs.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: Cheapest in Honda lineup (~Tk. 600 per service).

name: Honda Hornet 2.0
short_description: Honda Hornet 2.0 - A muscular 184cc streetfighter with aggressive styling, refined engine and premium features.

faqs.question: Difference from Hornet 160R?
faqs.answer: 2.0 has larger 184cc engine, more power and updated styling.

name: Honda Livo Disc CBS
short_description: Honda Livo Disc CBS - A premium 110cc commuter bike with refined engine, comfortable ergonomics and front disc brake with CBS.

faqs.question: Difference from Drum version?
faqs.answer: Disc version has front disc brake, alloy wheels and tubeless tires.

name: Honda Livo Drum CBS
short_description: Honda Livo Drum CBS - An affordable 110cc commuter bike with Honda reliability, good mileage and basic features.

faqs.question: Difference from Disc version?
faqs.answer: Drum version has spoke wheels, tube tires and drum brakes.

name: Honda Shine 100
short_description: Honda Shine 100 - An entry-level 100cc commuter bike offering excellent mileage, Honda reliability and basic commuting features.

faqs.question: Difference from Shine 125?
faqs.answer: Smaller 100cc engine, less power and more basic features.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: Cheapest in Honda lineup (~Tk. 500 per service).

name: Honda SP 125
short_description: Honda SP 125 - A premium 125cc commuter bike with sporty styling, refined engine and semi-digital instrument cluster.

faqs.question: Difference from Shine SP?
faqs.answer: SP 125 has more premium features like LED lights and digital console.

name: Honda SP 160
short_description: Honda SP 160 - A sporty 160cc streetfighter with aggressive styling, refined engine and premium features.

faqs.question: Difference from Hornet 160R?
faqs.answer: SP 160 has more aggressive styling and premium features.

name: Honda SP 160 ABS
short_description: Honda SP 160 ABS - The premium variant of SP 160 with single-channel ABS for enhanced safety and braking performance.

faqs.question: Difference from non-ABS?
faqs.answer: Adds ABS and slightly heavier, otherwise identical.

name: Honda X-Blade
short_description: Honda X-Blade - A futuristic streetfighter with sharp styling, 160cc engine and aggressive riding position.

faqs.question: Difference from Hornet?
faqs.answer: X-Blade has more futuristic design and different ergonomics.

name: Honda X-Blade ABS
short_description: Honda X-Blade ABS - The premium variant of X-Blade with single-channel ABS for enhanced safety and braking performance.

faqs.question: Difference from non-ABS?
faqs.answer: Adds ABS and slightly heavier, otherwise identical.

name: Bajaj Avenger 160 ABS
short_description: Bajaj Avenger 160 ABS - A stylish 160cc cruiser with relaxed ergonomics, single-channel ABS and comfortable long-distance capability.

faqs.question: Suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Best for riders under 6ft due to foot-forward position.

name: Bajaj CT100 ES
short_description: Bajaj CT100 ES - An ultra-affordable 100cc commuter bike known for exceptional mileage and low maintenance costs.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: Cheapest in Bajaj lineup (~Tk. 500 per service).

name: Bajaj Discover 110 Disc
short_description: Bajaj Discover 110 Disc - A premium 110cc commuter with front disc brake, alloy wheels and refined engine for comfortable city rides.

faqs.question: Difference from Drum version?
faqs.answer: Disc version has front disc brake and alloy wheels.

name: Bajaj Discover 125 Disc
short_description: Bajaj Discover 125 Disc - A 125cc commuter with sporty styling, front disc brake and comfortable riding position for daily commuting.

faqs.question: Difference from 110 version?
faqs.answer: 125 has more power, 5-speed gearbox and sportier styling.

name: Bajaj Platina 100 ES
short_description: Bajaj Platina 100 ES - A comfortable 100cc commuter with ES (Electric Start), good mileage and plush suspension for rough roads.

faqs.question: Difference from CT100?
faqs.answer: Platina has better suspension, electric start and more comfort features.

name: Bajaj Platina 110 H Gear Disc Brake
short_description: Bajaj Platina 110 H Gear Disc Brake - A 110cc commuter with comfortable ergonomics, front disc brake and H-Gear technology for better mileage.

faqs.question: What is H-Gear?
faqs.answer: Bajaj's technology that optimizes gear ratios for better mileage.
